messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Translation help,
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks guys for all your help.  I was just curious, I had seen a nicer version offered for sale before -not that I was buying either but I was curious.  Hope
messages.messageBody:
Thanks guys for all your help. I was just curious, I had seen a nicer version offered for sale before -not that I was buying either but I was curious. Hope all are enjoying their new years.
Ken




________________________________
From: Richard Turner <ikkanshi@...>
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, January 1, 2009 3:29:20 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Re: Translation help,


agreed, I would say Mino from the late 1600's or so. In fact, the last
line of the text on the right says it was made in 江戸 前& #26399; Edo Zenki,
zenki being the early part.

Cheers, and Happy New Year all.

Rich

--- In nihontostudy@ yahoogroups. com, "Ron Hartmann" <swords@...>
wrote:
>
> Hi Ken -
>
> This says "Mino" and not ko-Mino...and of course I can't read the
rest which would be a description of motif and how it was made. I
believe this work is placed in early Edo; ko-Mino would be earlier
(and look different).
>
> Ron
> STL

messages.subject: Re: Translation help,
messages.msgSnippet: agreed, I would say Mino from the late 1600 s or so. In fact, the last line of the text on the right says it was made in  江戸前期  Edo
messages.messageBody:
agreed, I would say Mino from the late 1600's or so. In fact, the last
line of the text on the right says it was made in 江戸前期 Edo Zenki,
zenki being the early part.

Cheers, and Happy New Year all.

Rich

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Translation help,
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Ken - This says Mino and not ko-Mino...and of course I can t read the rest which would be a description of motif and how it was made. I believe this work
messages.messageBody:
Hi Ken -

This says "Mino" and not ko-Mino...and of course I can't read the rest which would be a description of motif and how it was made. I believe this work is placed in early Edo; ko-Mino would be earlier (and look different).

Ron
STL

----- Original Message -----
From: Kenneth Wilson
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, January 01, 2009 11:22 AM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Translation help,


Happy New Year to all,

I hope all are enjoying things and not hungover. If anyone can translate what it is says in the box I would appreciate it. I assume it is komino piece.

http://page6.auctions.yahoo.co.jp/jp/auction/f75461813

I appreciate any help.

thanks.
Ken aka "the Mantis dude"
